But this (testing private methods) helps in quickly localizing the source o=
f the problem. Doesn=E2=80=99t it?

-----Original Message-----
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of El=
liotte Harold
Sent: Monday, September 05, 2005 2:43 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to test private methods in a class.

=20

Iliya Agoshkov wrote:

> Or I don't need to test em at all (cause they are tested through the
> test of 'public search(...)' method)??

Half right. You do need to test these methods. You test them by invoking=
=20
the public search method. Test methods do not need to directly invoke a=20
method in order to test it, provided that the methods they do invoke=20
ultimately reach into the methods being tested.

--=20
